task_summary: Detect the dishwasher handle, align and grasp it, then pull to open the hinged dishwasher door, verify it is open, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator operates in a kitchen scene with a stainless steel dishwasher below a small oven, a fridge on the left, and wooden cabinets on the right. The robot must locate the dishwasher handle, approach with proper yaw alignment, compute a pulling grasp on the bar handle, close the gripper, and execute an opening action consistent with a downward-hinged door. After actuating the door, the robot briefly waits, checks that the dishwasher is open, and retreats to clear the workspace.
preconditions: Dishwasher present with accessible bar handle
Path to the handle is collision-free
Gripper operational and capable of bar grasp
Perception can localize the handle in camera frame
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to the handle with tight tolerance.
Set tool yaw to match the horizontal bar.
Compute pull-style grasp and pick the handle.
Open the dishwasher as a hinged door.
Wait briefly and verify the door state.
success_criteria: Dishwasher door angle increases from closed state
Robot ends at a safe standoff without collisions
failure_and_recovery: If handle not detected: re-scan scene and adjust view
If grasp slips: re-align yaw and recompute grasp
If door resists: repeat open action with improved approach
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the dishwasher is confirmed open and the robot has retreated to the standoff position.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: pull actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Rotate end-effector yaw to align with bar handle.
Close gripper to secure handle using planned grasp.
Execute open action for hinged dishwasher door.
Back off to a safe standoff.

failure_modes: Handle not detected due to reflections
recovery_strategy: Repeat detection from a slightly different view
Re-align yaw and recompute grasp pose
Escalate timeout_ms within allowed bins if needed
assumptions: Dishwasher behaves as a downward hinged door; mapped to container_type "hinged_door".
Handle is a horizontal bar suitable for a pull grasp.
Frames show approach, contact, and open progression consistent with the instruction.

expected_success_criteria: OpenContainer returns success and ContainerOpen condition passes
Visible gap increase between door and chassis
Robot maintains stable grasp throughout pull
